dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1698 : Bullion and Collectible Coin Production Efficiency and Cost Savings Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To amend design and content requirements for certain gold and silver coins, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Bullion and Collectible Coin Production Efficiency and Cost Savings Act.
Title 31, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4), (5), (6), and (7) as paragraphs (3), (4), (5), and (6), respectively;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (t)(6)(B), by striking 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper and inserting not less than 90 percent silver; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking Subject to and all that follows through the Secretary shall and inserting The Secretary shall;
in paragraph (2)(A), by striking The Secretary and inserting To the greatest extent possible, the Secretary;
in paragraph (5), by inserting after may issue the following: collectible versions of; and

paragraph.text: in section 5132(a)(2)(B)(i), by striking 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper and inserting not less than 90 percent silver.

section.text: Proof and uncirculated versions of coins issued by the Secretary of the Treasury pursuant to subsection (e) of section 5112 of title 31, United States Code, during calendar year 2016 shall have a smooth edge incused with a designation that notes the 30th anniversary of the first issue of coins under such subsection.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives June 23, 2015.
